org.nodex.java.core

Class DeferredAction<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodex.java.core.SimpleFuture<T>
      • org.nodex.java.core.DeferredAction<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Deferred<T>, Future<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SynchronousAction

    public abstract class DeferredAction<T>
extends SimpleFuture<T>
implements Deferred<T>

    DeferredAction is useful when you want to create your own Deferred actions.

    Normally, instances of Deferred are returned from node.x modules to represent operations such as getting a key from a Redis server, or copying a file. However if you wish to create your own instances you can do this by subclassing this class and implementing the run() method.

    When the operation is complete be sure to call SimpleFuture.setResult(T) or SimpleFuture.setException(java.lang.Exception)

    Author:
    Tim Fox

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public Deferred<T> execute()
        Execute the deferred operation. If the Deferred has already been executed the call will be ignored. Once the deferred has been executed it behaves like a Future.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface Deferred<T>
        Returns:
        a reference to this

      • handler

        public Deferred<T> handler(CompletionHandler<T> completionHandler)
        Set a handler on the Future. If the operation has already completed it will be called immediately, otherwise it will be called when the operation completes or fails, passing in a reference to this.
        Specified by:
        handler in interface Deferred<T>
        Specified by:
        handler in interface Future<T>
        Overrides:
        handler in class SimpleFuture<T>
